definitions.definition: The oxide of zirconium , obtained as a white powder, and possessing both acid and basic properties. On account of its infusibility , and brilliant luminosity when incandescent , it is used as an ingredient of sticks for the Drummond light .

main_definition: ( chemistry ) The oxide of zirconium , obtained as a white powder, and possessing both acid and basic properties. On account of its infusibility , and brilliant luminosity when incandescent , it is used as an ingredient of sticks for the Drummond light .
